text.headline: The first collections
text.text: in panic... targeting the most obvious sites

text.headline: People are trying to do what they can

media.caption: National Literary Memorial Museum of H.S. Skovoroda

text.headline: International Council of Museums (ICOM)
text.text: called on civil society in Ukraine to assist their local museums to protect their holdings https://icom.museum/en/news/statement-russia-invasion-into-ukraine/

media.caption: Draft version of archiveteam warrior logo

text.text: Archive Team starts major website crawls with crowd sourced computing power (warrior) a virtual archiving appliance anyone can run and help with the archiving efforts

text.headline: Wikidata as a source
text.text: On the second day we managed to extract 1300 urls from wikipedia articles

media.credit: Alex KhristovDesign: Wasyl Krytschewskyj, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: First contact with Ukrainian authorities
text.text: With the help of friends of friends, we get in touch with people who work in various authorities in Ukraine. These people help us identify and prioritize the most important websites.

text.headline: SUCHO is born
text.text: A tweet is spreading.... within a few days, hundreds of volunteers joined.
